definitions.definition: The property of all possible outcomes being equally likely .
A type of circumstance or event that is described by a probability distribution .
A measure of the lack of purpose , logic , or objectivity of an event .
examples: There was no randomness in the teacher's selection of the class representative.

main_definition: The property of all possible outcomes being equally likely .
secondary_definitions: ( mathematics ) A type of circumstance or event that is described by a probability distribution .
A measure of the lack of purpose , logic , or objectivity of an event .
